Description: Limestone stela: rough with a rounded top, bearing an incised inscription giving the name of the official Ip, with the a title. The left hand side of the stela has been broken away, with the loss of part of the figure of the seated man which followed the name, and of most of another hieroglyph to the left of the title. The surface of the stone is in good condition.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tomb of Den, subsidiary grave
Curator's comments: The technique of the inscription is unusual, the outlines having been cut by sideways chiselling or gentle hammering, creating a zig-zag effect instead of a clean line. Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' I, pls. XXXI, 23; XXXIV, 23; British Museum, 'Hieroglyphic Texts from Egyptian Stelae, etc'., I (London), pl. I.
